alert.note: Alert for Des Moines; Henry; Keokuk; Louisa; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 29 at 10:20AM CDT until June 29 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1100 AM CDT FOR HENRY...DES MOINES...LOUISA...SOUTHEASTERN KEOKUK...SOUTHERN WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COUNTIES... At 1020 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Washington County Fairgrounds to near Noble to Salem, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Burlington, Fairfield, Mount Pleasant, Washington, Wapello, Columbus Junction, West Burlington, New London, Mediapolis, Winfield, Wayland, Danville, Morning Sun, Brighton, Richland, Ainsworth, Grandview, Batavia, Columbus City and Letts. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Des Moines; Henry; Keokuk; Louisa; Washington
